snippet: In his decision, a Manhattan judge cites a young man’s traumatic adolescence and argues that he can be rehabilitated....
abstract: Judge Paul A Engelmayer of Federal District Court rules 18-year-old known as CF may not be prosecuted as adult for crimes committed as teenager, saying his rough background contributed to his participation in violent acts and that he could be rehabilitated; suspect was arrested in few months short of his eighteenth birthday in December 2015 for criminal activity carried out while member of 18 Park gang in South Bronx.
lead_paragraph: In his decision, a Manhattan judge cites a young man’s traumatic adolescence and argues that he can be rehabilitated.

headline.main: Bronx Teenager Won’t Be Tried as Adult in Gang Case
headline.print_headline: Teenager Won’t Be Tried as Adult in a Gang Case
